headline.main: G. W. Wheelwright III, 97, Dies; Co-Founder of Polaroid

lead_paragraph: George W. Wheelwright III, a co-founder of the company that eventually became the Polaroid Corporation, died on Thursday at the Marin Convalescent Center in Tiburon, Calif. He was 97. Most of the world thinks of Polaroid as the brainchild of Edwin H. Land, a scientist whose ideas for a lens that could polarize light -- that is, make light rays move in parallel -- formed the technological underpinnings of glare-free sunglasses and later of instant photography. In fact, the company had two parents: Mr. Land and Mr. Wheelwright.
